name: Sun
description: The star at the center of our Solar System, containing 99.86% of the system's mass. A G-type main-sequence star.

name: Mercury
description: Smallest planet, closest to the Sun. Has extreme temperature variations from -173°C to 427°C.

name: Venus
description: Hottest planet due to runaway greenhouse effect. Rotates backwards (retrograde rotation).

name: Earth
description: Only known planet to support life. 71% water coverage. Has one natural satellite (Moon).

name: Mars
description: The Red Planet. Home to Olympus Mons (largest volcano) and Valles Marineris (largest canyon).

name: Jupiter
description: Largest planet. Famous for Great Red Spot (giant storm). Has 95 known moons.

name: Saturn
description: Famous for spectacular ring system. Less dense than water. Has 146 known moons.

name: Uranus
description: Rotates on its side (98° axial tilt). Blue-green color from methane in atmosphere.

name: Neptune
description: Windiest planet with supersonic winds up to 2,100 km/h. Deep blue color from methane.

name: Moon
description: Earth's only natural satellite. Fifth largest moon in solar system. Causes tides on Earth.

name: Sirius
description: Brightest star in night sky. Binary star system in Canis Major. Distance: 8.6 light-years.

name: Canopus
description: Second brightest star in night sky. White supergiant. Distance: 310 light-years.

name: Arcturus
description: Fourth brightest star. Red giant in Boötes. Distance: 37 light-years.

name: Vega
description: Fifth brightest star. Part of Summer Triangle. Distance: 25 light-years.

name: Rigel
description: Blue supergiant in Orion. Seventh brightest star. Distance: 860 light-years.

name: Betelgeuse
description: Red supergiant in Orion. Variable star. May explode as supernova. Distance: 640 light-years.

name: Polaris
description: North Star. Currently marks celestial north pole. Triple star system. Distance: 433 light-years.

name: Andromeda Galaxy
description: Nearest major galaxy to Milky Way. Will collide with Milky Way in 4.5 billion years. Contains 1 trillion stars.

name: Orion Nebula
description: Nearest massive star-forming region to Earth. Visible to naked eye. Distance: 1,344 light-years.

name: Pleiades
description: Open star cluster (Seven Sisters). Contains over 1,000 stars. Distance: 444 light-years.
